contactSalesCardMainText: Contact sales to get a pre-paid subscription or modify limits of your current subscription.
heroDescription: Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache $t(common:kafka) is a managed cloud service that provides a streamlined developer experience for building, deploying, and scaling real-time applications in hybrid-cloud environments. The combination of seamless operations across distributed microservices, large data transfer volumes, and managed operations allows teams to focus on core competencies, accelerate application velocity and reduce operational cost.
heroTagline: Fully hosted and managed service for stream-based applications
heroTitle: Get started with Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache $t(common:kafka)
kafkaInstanceCapacityDescription: Streams for Apache $t(common:kafka) offers instances in the following sizes with the following capacity.
kafkaInstanceCapacityfooter: *Storage can be extended. If you wish to increase the storage limit for a $t(common:kafka) instance, contact <0>Red Hat support</0> to discuss your options. You can check your current storage usage by <1>monitoring disk space metrics</1>.
purchaseCardMainText: In the United States or Canada, purchase a pay-as-you-go subscription for up to 25 streaming units through Red Hat Marketplace.
streamingUnitText: A <bold>streaming unit</bold> determines the default maximum capacity of a $t(common:kafka) instance. The more streaming units your $t(common:kafka) instance has, the larger its capacity will be.
